thread.title: Florida Atlantic: Owls prepping for Marshall's dangerous kick returner
thread.title_full: Florida Atlantic: Owls prepping for Marshall's dangerous kick returner - Sun Sentinel

author: Shandel Richardson
title: Florida Atlantic: Owls prepping for Marshall's dangerous kick returner
text:
Florida Atlantic spent more than the usual amount of time working on special teams this week.
The reason was simple. The Owls are facing one of the nation's top kick returners in Marshall's Deandre Reaves. He is averaging 30.7 yards a return and scored one touchdown.
"He's a ridiculous kick returner," FAU coach Charlie Partridge said. "He has two touchdowns, one of them got called back. The one that got called back was an unbelievable display of athleticism. He's pretty special."
Last year, Reaves ranked seventh in the nation, averaging 29.1 yards a return. He is Marshall's all-time leader in return yardage.
Johnson stays positive
It hasn't been exactly the type of season senior quarterback Jaquez Johnson envisioned. He's spent most of the year dealing with a nagging ankle injury that has slowed him.
Partridge said Johnson has remained positive despite the struggles.
"To his credit, he's been great," Partridge said. "He's doing everything he can. We got the best version of [Johnson] we possibly could have."
A model program
When it comes to building a program, the Owls can look no further than Marshall for the blueprint.
The Thundering Herd is on pace for a second straight Conference USA championship. Partridge said he can pattern some things after what coach Doc Holiday has done since 2010.
"I talked to Doc a decent amount," Partridge said. "I met him when he was at N.C. State. You look at what he did. He built a program. He had a bowl-game season his second year â€¦ Now, he's had the chance to build a program. Sure, there are things that they do that we'll model just like any good program."
Next game: FAU vs. Marshall, Noon, Saturday, Fox College Sports
